spec.title: The Target Class Specification
spec.header: This Class Models a Target, A Common Household Pet

variables.var: an array of pointers to the Target's children dependencies

constructor.statechange: initialize children, parents, numParents, numChildren, and posInited to 0 and targetName to an empty string
initializes the same values as the default constructor, but sets targetName to n

arguments.arg: a pointer to the target's parent

constructor.statechange: same as previous constructor, but adds the parent p to the list of parent targets

destructor.statechange: if memory was allocated at children or parents, it is deallocated

method.name: addChildren
method.desc: searches for children named in dl in all trees, and add the pointer(s) to the children list, otherwise, newly construct a target with the name(s)

arguments.arg: a list of target names separated by spaces in one string
a pointer to the array of root targets

method.statechange: the array stored at children in the calling target is copied to a new array which is expanded to the correct size to hold the pointers, and new targets are constructed as necessary (if they could not be found in any existing trees)

method.name: addParent
method.desc: adds the pointer to target p to the list of parents in the calling object
method.statechange: the array pointed to by parents is deleted if it exists, and replaced by an array one larger with the same contents, but the final element being the pointer p

method.name: setName
method.desc: changes the targetName string in the calling object

arguments.arg: a string containting the new name

method.statechange: targetName is set to n in the calling object

method.name: getName
method.desc: returns the name of the target

method.name: getPosX/getPosY
method.desc: returns the x/y position of the calling object

method.name: findTarget
method.desc: searches all children of calling Target, as well as calling object for the name n, and returns one that does
method.return: a pointer to a target which is the calling target, or one of its children with a name matching n

method.name: initPositions
method.desc: recursive function which generates x and y positions for targets in the callers tree based on their depth, and a random number between 1 and 100

arguments.arg: the current depth in the tree (default 0)
the horizantal index in the tree (default 0)

method.statechange: posX and posY of caller and all of its children are initialized based on their depth, horizantal index in the search, and random numbers between 1 and 100

method.name: printTree
method.desc: convenient way to debug the positions and dependencies of tree
